Taxon name.Name: Saccharomyces cerevisiae
Taxon name.Synonymy:
Current name: Saccharomyces cerevisiae (Desmazières) Meyen 1838 MB#492348 
Basionym: Mycoderma cerevisiae Desmazières 1827 MB#166349 
Obligate synonyms: 
   - Mycokluyveria cerevisiae (Desmazières) Ciferri & Redaelli 1947 MB#288584 
   - Saccharomyces cerevisiae Meyen ex E.C. Hansen 1883 MB#163963 
   - Eutorulopsis cerevisiae (Desmazières) Ciferri & Redaelli 1929 MB#251368 
   - Eutorula cerevisiae (Desmazières) H. Will 1916 MB#535088 
   - Kloeckera cerevisiae (Desmazières) Janke 1923 MB#541144

Other culture collection numbers: ATCC 9080; B 24819; CBS 2354; CCRC 20855; DBVPG 6248; DSM 70424; IFO 0565; NCYC 74; NRRL Y-1089; VTT C-66065
Nagoya protocol restrictions and complia: no known restrictions under the Nagoya protocol
Applications: assay of pantothenic acid (Appl. Microbiol. 14: 462-465, 1966; Kavanagh F., ed. Analytical Microbiology. New York: Academic Press; 1963: pp. 489-495 and 503-505), inositol and pyridoxine (ibid., pp. 489-495), vitamin B6 (AACC Method 86-31; AOAC Methods 961.15 and 985.32) and  pyridoxal, pyridoxamine and pyridoxine (Ind. Eng. Chem. 15: 141-144, 1923; Med. Lab. Technol. 29: 160-170, 1972; J. Vitaminol. (Kyoto)18: 90-96, 1972); maltose fermentation (Mol. Gen. Genet. 115: 80-88, 1972; ibid., 123: 233-246, 1973); alpha-glucosidase synthesis (Biochim. Biophys. Acta 294: 517-526, 1973; ibid., 204: 590-609, 1970); NADH oscillations (J. Interdiscip. Cycle Res. 10: 41-50, 1979); spatiotemporal organization (J. Cell Sci. 43: 367-377, 1980); produces: proteinase B inhibitor IB3 (Eur. J. Biochem. 101: 325-332, 1979), niacin and niacin-related compounds (J. Nutr. Sci. Vitaminol. 28: 179-189, 1982), endo- deoxyribonuclease A (Eur. Pat. Off. Publ. No. 0060465 A2), ergosterol (Biochem. Biophys. Res. Commun. 103: 272-277, 1981; Biotechnol. Lett. 12: 277-282, 1990; ibid., 13: 97-100, 1991) and alpha-glucosidase in brewery waste (Acta Cient. Venez. 40: 40-45, 1989); reduction of 3-methoxy-8 (14)-seco-1,3,5 (10),9 (11)-estra-tetraene-14, 17-dione (U.S. Pat. 3,562,112); induction of giant cells (Radiat. Environ. Biophys. 23: 19-30, 1984; ibid., 24: 9-16, 1985); sterol synthesis (Biochim. Biophys. Acta 531: 86-95, 1978); does not carry 2 micron DNA plasmid (J. Inst. Brew. 86: 78-80, 1980); genetics and biochemistry (Mol. Gen.  Genet. 115: 80-88, 1972); respiration  (Adv. Biotechnol. 2: 225-230, 1981); oscillation in glycolysis (Biophys. J. 60: 369-379, 1991)
